comments.body: Isn't this conceptually the same lock that the windows script acquires in "acquire_lock"? Does that logic need to be updated as well?
It does ... but that was more difficult, due to how much longer the check is/gotos

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +127,131 @@    # the lock entirely, but as a result this required a second verification that
    # the SDK is up to date.
    _wait_for_lock

    # A different shell process might have updated the tool/SDK.
